channel.title: Status Page Open-source
channel.description:
Well i'm relasing a "Working" status page that i found and i edited, its easy to use, i'm not going to bother explaining what it does or what it is, its a status page and its very blank and simple, feel free to edit it.
http://www.mediafire.com/?n3221zqjwat
Credit's: _ikram m.dog311

item.title: Status Page Open-source
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I don’t know what world whoever wrote this lives in, but in my world you have to be joined into the hamachi network before that will ever work.

It was written on a rsps site, what do you expect?

Read full topic

item.title: Status Page Open-source
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Here is a snippet from the ‘hamachi server page’:

$ss = @fsockopen($_POST['serverhost'], $_POST['serverport'], $errno, $errstr, 2);

I don’t know what world whoever wrote this lives in, but in my world you have to be joined into the hamachi network before that will ever work.

Also, judging by the hamachi mysql database:

CREATE TABLE `hamserverlist` ( `id` bigint(20) NOT NULL auto_increment, `servername` varchar(35) NOT NULL default '', `serverhost` varchar(35) NOT NULL, `serverport` varchar(6) NOT NULL default '', `added` datetime default NULL, `failed` bigint(20) NOT NULL default '0', `checks` bigint(20) NOT NULL default '0', `status` tinyint(1) NOT NULL default '0', `password` varchar(32) NOT NULL default '', PRIMARY KEY (`id`), KEY `success` (`checks`) ) TYPE=MyISAM AUTO_INCREMENT=1 ;

It doesn’t even have a position for the hamachi network name, so what good would it be?

Read full topic

item.title: Status Page Open-source
item.dc:creator: @Unlimited1 .Unlimited
item.description:
@Unlimited1 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:285948”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=378190.msg2846024#msg2846024 date=1246288095]
My sources tell me that, this was released on frugoo’s site, and all you did was combine the config file with the index and take out the hamachi support.
[/quote]

I would like to see this ‘hamachi support’. Does it actually check to see if the server is online?[/quote]

http://frugoosoft.com/forums/showthread.php?t=23274

Read full topic

item.title: Status Page Open-source
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[code] $list_q = mysql_query(“SELECT id,servername,serverhost,serverport,added,failed,checks,status FROM serverlist”) or die (mysql_error());

while($list_f = mysql_fetch_assoc($list_q)) {

	if($C_Settings['update'] == 1) {

		$ss = @fsockopen($list_f['serverhost'], $list_f['serverport'], $errno, $errstr, 2);[/code]

I can’t wait for a lot of people to start using this then complain when their hosts shuts them down for BWraep.

Read full topic

item.title: Status Page Open-source
item.dc:creator: @imjohn10 imjohn10
item.description:
@imjohn10 wrote:

got some xss and sql injection vulnerabilities there. (learn to use htmlentities and mysql_real_escape_string)

But apart from that not the worst thing I have seen.

Read full topic

item.title: Status Page Open-source
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[code]<?php
$ip = $_GET[‘ip’];
if(@fsockopen($ip, 43594, $errno, $errstr, 1)) {
echo “OMG ITS ONLINE”;
} else {
echo “U suk, its offline.”;
}
?>

OMG, This makes me awesome because its open source and it works!![/code]

Read full topic
